name: Active Scanning
description: Adversaries may scan victim infrastructure to gather information that can be used during targeting. Active scanning can be used to detect open ports, services, and vulnerabilities.

name: Network Service Scanning
description: Adversaries may scan for open ports and services to identify running services and potential vulnerabilities.

name: Application Layer Protocol
description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.

name: Ingress Tool Transfer
description: Adversaries may transfer tools or other files from an external system into a compromised environment.

name: Valid Accounts
description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of existing accounts as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

name: Cloud Accounts
description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of cloud accounts as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

name: Credentials in Files
description: Adversaries may search for credentials stored in files on compromised systems.

name: Brute Force
description: Adversaries may use brute force techniques to gain access to accounts when passwords are unknown or when password hashes are obtained.

name: Transfer Data to Cloud Account
description: Adversaries may exfiltrate data by transferring it to a cloud account they control.

name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an existing command and control channel.

name: Domain Policy Modification
description: Adversaries may modify domain policies to maintain persistence or evade defenses.

name: Resource Hijacking
description: Adversaries may leverage cloud resources for cryptocurrency mining or other resource-intensive tasks.
